text: Sir Hans Leo Kornberg, FRS (14 January 1928 â€“ 16 December 2019) was a German- born British-American biochemist.The Academy of Europe (2015) Curriculum Vitae: Sir Hans Kornberg https://www.ae- info.org/attach/User/Kornberg_Hans/CV/SirHansKornberg%20CV.pdf He was Sir William Dunn Professor of Biochemistry in the University of Cambridge from 1975 to 1995, and Master of Christ's College, Cambridge from 1982 to 1995. He was born in Herford, Germany. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. Kornberg died on 16 December 2019 in Boston, Massachusetts at the age of 91. ==References== ==Other websites== *British Humanist Society Distinguished Supporters * Jewish Year Book, 2005, p. 214: List of Jewish Fellows of the Royal Society *Professor Sir Hans Kornberg FRS in Conversation with Sir James Baddiley FRS October 1990 *Current research interests (Boston University Biology Department) *Sir Hans Kornberg (Boston University Biology Department) Category:1928 births Category:2019 deaths Category:British biochemists Category:American biochemists Category:Academics of the University of Cambridge Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Hans Kornberg
